channel.title: Owen F. Davis
channel.description: Recent content on Owen F. Davis

item.title: How Does the Earned Income Tax Credit Work? Exploring the Role of Commuting and Personal Transportation
item.description: This paper uses a simulated instrument approach to explore the personal transportation and commuting mechanism behind the Earned Income Tax Credit.

item.title: How did COVID-19 affect the labor force participation of older workers in the first year of the pandemic?
item.description: This paper uses the Current Population Survey to study older workers' transitions out of employment and into retirement during the first year of the pandemic.

item.title: Retirement Reforms Are Necessaryâ€”So Is Strengthening Social Security
item.description: In light of growing calls for retirement system reform, this report assesses the economic effects of Social Security.

item.title: Dissecting the Pandemic Retirement Surge
item.description: This report explores the drivers of the pandemic retirement surge, finding that it was driven primarily by increased transitions to retirement.

item.title: Employment and retirement among older workers during the Covid-19 pandemic
item.description: This paper provides a comprehensive examination of employment and retirement transitions among older workers during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: The Pandemic Retirement Surge Increased Retirement Inequality
item.description: This report quantifies the scale of the Covid-19 retirement boom and explores disparities by race and education in pandemic labor market outcomes.

item.title: A First in Nearly 50 Years, Older Workers Face Higher Unemployment Than Mid-Career Workers
item.description: This report examines labor market outcomes for older workers in comparison to younger and mid-career workers in the first six months of the pandemic.

item.title: Money Parables (Phenomenal World)
item.description: Market societies use narratives to justify the social technology of money. Three money parables stand out: credit money, commodity money and chartalism.

item.title: The Emerging Monopsony Consensus (Phenomenal World)
item.description: Under the banner of monopsony, economists have built an impressive catalog of empirical work that offers a more plausible baseline model for labor markets.

item.title: The Next Shareholder Revolution
item.description: This report analyzes the history of social reformers interested in using financial technologies and institutions for egalitarian ends.

item.title: All Roads Lead To Wall Street (Dissent)
item.description: This article explores the financialization of protest and social movements: the use of shareholder activism to achieve egalitarian ends.
